lenders.name: James
lenders.loan_because: people need help

lenders.name: madhu
lenders.loan_because: i want to start a little gaming zone buisness...  that have a lots of money to start that buiness... so please any one help me...

lenders.name: Kerwin
lenders.loan_because: I am from a developing country and have seen the need that exists there and the effects when this need is not met by the governments - either because they simply can't or they just don't want to.  Lending is a sure way to help empower the poor, but mostly I think it allows for a certain reconstitution, or an establishment, of self respect because the poor are now able to help themselves and their families out through their own efforts, not through a handout.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm being 'an accessory' to the change that I seek in the world.

lenders.name: Timothy
lenders.loan_because: God has been good to us and we want to share our good fortune with businesspeople in other countries who are trying to improve their lives and build their countries.
lenders.occupational_info: Tim works in marketing, helping businesses tell customers about their products. Leslie works in banking, helping people to manage their money.

lenders.name: Simona
lenders.loan_because: I should.  It's great to have the opportunity to helps someone start their own business or expand their business. I'm happy to be a part of it.

lenders.name: susan
lenders.occupational_info: Nordland, WA

lenders.name: class of 09
lenders.loan_because: we loan because there is a sincere desire to help others in need throughout our classroom.

lenders.name: Gilles
lenders.loan_because: Banks exploit people by asking them high interests.
lenders.occupational_info: I am studying Social Work

lenders.name: Ajit Verghese
lenders.loan_because: as an Entrepreneur, I believe that we need to establish a culture of giving which starts in our communities, moves local and then goes global. Every entrepreneur had someone in their lives that gave them their first break. As entrepreneurs, It is imperative that we get involved!
lenders.occupational_info: I just finished my MBA from Babson and am launching a tech startup as well as consulting in the tech / social media space for a few brands. I am involved in the convergence of the technology, the Internet, new media, and music.....and I am trying to find a way to change the world I live in.

lenders.name: Beijo
lenders.loan_because: I can, even though I am retired on a fixed income. My strategy has been to loan $25 a month until the repaid loans would be coming back at the rate of $25 a month, then continue to reinvest. I was surprised that it took a short 8 months, and since then I have only been reinvesting. It is so much fun to see and hear from people all over the world! I don't recommend my stragegy if you can give more, but for me, it works well.

lenders.name: Patricia
lenders.loan_because: I believe in the people who have to work and support their families  in 3rd world countries .  We have to work as in concert with the world to feed and educate the children.  Hungry, poverty stricken, uneducated children do not make good world leaders.  This is one way to change the order of things to a more balanced, conscious society.
lenders.occupational_info: My background is nursing.  I have volunteered 3x in Tanzania and am deeply gratified by doing so.

lenders.name: Kevin
lenders.loan_because: I would want the same opportunity.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach Economics and other social studies classes to students in international schools.

lenders.name: Andrew
lenders.loan_because: What better way to help someone who is trying to better themselves in a developing country. I know lending through Kiva that all the money I lend goes to the person I want.

lenders.name: Clyde
lenders.loan_because: I love to give and I want to see others succeed all over the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I fix computers, I network computers, I build websites, I advise on social networking.

lenders.name: Erin
lenders.loan_because: I think we can make a difference, one person at a time.

lenders.name: Tom
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people who are working hard to better themselves.

lenders.name: Ben
lenders.loan_because: "A society that has more justice is a society that needs less charity." Ralph Nader
lenders.occupational_info: Working with organisations to help them focus on what they do best by helping them to structure their aims, prioritise their 'to do' list and create good working practice.

lenders.name: Disinterestedwisdom

They are asking only for a hand-up, not a hand-out.
lenders.occupational_info: I am the mother of 3 grown children and have 6 grandchildren. I am truely blessed with family, food, and good water. Call me "Living the good life in the United States."

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: Much has been given to me. I want to give to others.

lenders.name: Chris

lenders.occupational_info: I help to make work processes and work tools more usable for people, which reduces stress and injuries.

lenders.name: Claire
lenders.loan_because: I have been fortunate to have had a good education and a good job to support my family.  I want to share my bounty with others sot hey can have better lives, too.
lenders.occupational_info: To Design and Build Oil and Gas Plants

lenders.name: Gaby
lenders.loan_because:
I want to make a difference in the world, 
so I am starting with baby steps.
lenders.occupational_info: I work full time in front of a computer making books. At home I paint and make crafts.

lenders.name: Martine
lenders.loan_because: I had a dream that one day every human being on earth would live decently... That's a way to fullfil my dream.

lenders.name: Zachary
lenders.loan_because: If I am able to help, then I have a responsibility to do so.  Simple enough huh?  Wish more people thought that way.

lenders.name: Holly
lenders.loan_because: I have seen the beauty of many faces, many religons, many ways of life the world over.  One thing is clear: we are all the same. We all have the same hopes and dreams. If my little contribution can change someone's life, then I have made the world a better place.
lenders.occupational_info: I am interested in how people lived a long time ago. What did they look like? What was their art like? What types of things did they use everyday for farming, eating, jewelry, clothing? I dig in the ground for remnants of the things people left behind long ago.  If you do this carefully you can get a lot fo information from each layer of earth that you dig up. Sometimes I find broken pottery, glass, arrow heads, and beads. I have also found human and animal bones.  Human bones tell us a lot about how people lived. They can tell us their age, their health, and sometimes their status.  I find ancient and modern people very fascinating!

lenders.name: Kelly and David Funk
lenders.loan_because: Even small amounts of U.S. dollars can make a tremendous difference in the lives of others living in developing countries. And, it's the right thing to do...
lenders.occupational_info: Investors and volunteers at Peace Awareness Labryrinth and Gardens in Los Angeles, CA,  www.peacelabyrinth.org

lenders.name: Burke
lenders.loan_because: Giving is getting.
lenders.occupational_info: Learn from kids and they learn from me.

lenders.name: paul
lenders.loan_because: Are you looking or have been looking for financial assistance,help or loan?here comes a great opportunity.i am a certified and licensed lender and i have some money to lend out to any serious and honest person[s] or firm[s] who need either long or stort term loans at 4% as the interest rate,if interested contact me via mail:paulokojie13@yahoo.com

I believe that if I can help make the difference in one life I will have lived for a greater purpose than that of my own sake.
lenders.occupational_info: My company maintains a "First Responder" team which services catastrophe loss sites that are results of hurricane, flooding and earthquake disasters.

lenders.occupational_info: Surf Goddess Retreats is a surf, yoga & spa vacation created especially for women. We provide a space where women can have fun learning to surf, while also taking time to pamper themselves in an enchanting environment that revitalizes body, mind and spirit.

lenders.name: edward
lenders.loan_because: I feel that it is a great way to give back and maybe, just maybe make the world a better place.

lenders.name: Kenia
lenders.loan_because:
I believe there is abundance in the world!  I am NOT anti-poverty; I AM pro-entrepreneurship, pro-business, pro-wealth.  I believe in the power of positive thinking, and in helping others not out of pity, but out of compassion and knowledge that there is plenty in the world to go around!

I stand behind the saying: "Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day.  Teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime."  Of course, one still needs to eat today before he manages to learn for himself in the future!  Kiva is essentially the way to give someone fish so that they may reach their business goals and fish for themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I design satellites, and I love to write!

lenders.name: Jenni
lenders.loan_because: everyone needs help and I respect those that work towards their goals.
lenders.occupational_info: The main function of my job is getting ink on paper.

lenders.name: Molly
lenders.loan_because: I was lucky to be born in the US and raised with love, comfort and education.  Loaning to others in need is the least I can do to give back to the world that has given so much to me.
lenders.occupational_info: I help employees and companies who have disagreements with each other come to an agreement.

lenders.name: Megan
lenders.loan_because: I believe the individuals I lend to should have access to finance.
lenders.occupational_info: I was a Kiva Fellow in Cote d'Ivoire & Togo in 2008. And now I work at Kiva!

I have seen first hand how hard it is to get a business started and for me this is a great way to give a little something back and hopefully give someone a little help to improve their businesses and their quality of life.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm very lucky. I work to live and as soon as I have enough I'm off to somewhere new to explore. I love to walk and am just about to begin (June 1st 2007) a walk from the furthest point North of Europe to the furthest point south

lenders.name: Mary
lenders.loan_because: I want to assist these brave people in their efforts to make something of themselves and to care for their families.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a "jack of all trades" at my company. I proofread, edit, project manage, create or otherwise contribute to the communications materials used by my company to promote our products.

lenders.occupational_info: I work with businesses to help them understand their financial performance

lenders.name: Mikko
lenders.loan_because: This is a marvelous idea to help people in poorer countries help themselves. Passive foreign aid may often be a double-edged sword (though yes, necessary at times). Thanks to Kiva ("Nice" in Finnish, by the way :) for enabling people around the world to instead spur people into helping themselves and their society.
lenders.occupational_info: I manage GNU/Linux computer systems and communications networks at the University of Helsinki. This might not mean much to most people, sorry, but I don't know how else to put it. I do hope that the One Laptop Per Child project will make both GNU/Linux computers and computer networking, among other things, more familiar to also people in poorer countries.

lenders.name: Blair

lenders.name: Jessica
lenders.loan_because: I still believe that I can make a difference.
lenders.occupational_info: Learning and teaching

lenders.name: Edward
lenders.loan_because: I believe in the amplifying effect of lending to an entrepreneur.  For every dollar I lend to a business person, I know that much more than than is brought to the people that are served by that business.
lenders.occupational_info: I design electronic systems and manage a team of engineers and technicians.  Together we help deliver news and entertainment to the public.

lenders.name: Deb
lenders.loan_because: I've been given many, many gifts. I'm glad that I am now in a postion to begin giving back.
lenders.occupational_info: My primary job is to be a good Mom!  At my job I manage software development projects.

lenders.occupational_info:
I write books. The newest, now being written, is about why and how people help each other, and how we feel about helping -- in our own words. 

If you help others (not for a paycheck) and would like to participate in the research for the book, go to my website and click on "Next". Read about the book, and send me email.

lenders.name: Stephen
lenders.loan_because: Loans can make a difference.

lenders.name: Zoe and Dre
lenders.loan_because: We decided to use the money we had set aside for party favors for  our wedding guests to make recurring loans to entrepreneurs through Kiva. We have made four loans to date, and plan on continuing to loan the repaid money forever.
lenders.occupational_info: Zoe is a lawyer and Dre recently started his own business - Capital Kombucha, which was one of the first companies to raise money using Kiva's new Zip program.

lenders.name: Edgar
lenders.loan_because: I have been blessed and want to share my good fortune with others.  I taught Economics/Free Enterprise for 15 years.  I want to help all I can to have a better life through ingenuity and work.  I believe in those I have seen on this site.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach World History in a high school, but I taught Economics/Free Enterprise for 15 years.

lenders.loan_because: It's just the right thing to do....

lenders.name: Susan
lenders.loan_because: it is helpful.

lenders.name: Melanie
lenders.loan_because: What could be more satisfying than helping hardworking folks grow their businesses and prosper?

lenders.name: Judith
lenders.loan_because: It's the right thing to do;  and I love the idea that I can make a difference in someone's life.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm retired now, but for 32 years  I supervised a word processing center in an urban school district. I also taught typing  in adult night school.

lenders.name: jeff
lenders.loan_because: its my way of making a difference
lenders.occupational_info: advise and mentor business leadership teams

lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because: It's a great way to "give" to charity.  In my mind, education and hard work ultimately result in social equity and opportunity.  Microfinance helps support hard work, and for parents might help send more kids to school to increase their social opportunities.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a graduate student studying fuel cells.  I hope to teach college within in the next 3-5 years.  The picture is my daughter.

lenders.name: Jose R.
lenders.loan_because: I believe on the principle of support private initiative as the foundation to freedon
lenders.occupational_info: Project Manager on the Oil, Gas and Petrochemical Industries

lenders.name: Jeffrey
lenders.loan_because:
this is one of the ways in which I am "paying it forward."  
"Think of an idea for world change, and put it into action."
lenders.occupational_info: I was a Peace Corps Volunteer in Ghana in the 1980's.

lenders.name: JAMIE
lenders.loan_because: It's the right thing to do and it feels great to help someone.

lenders.name: Jed
lenders.loan_because: I'd like to help people out but I don't have a lot of disposable income so this seems like a good way to help a lot of people with the small amount of money I can contribute.
lenders.occupational_info: I am an environmental and forensic scientist for a non-profit natural gas research institute.

lenders.name: MC_Glick
lenders.loan_because:
1) I like to help people who want to help themselves.

2) Kiva lets me be an alternative to the usurious loans that apparently dominate in developing countries.

3) I'm opposed to government foreign aid that goes to kleptocracies and ineffective (or even destructive) big-budget projects and rarely filters down to those who truly need it.

4) Business is the free exchange of goods and services between people. If anything makes the world go round, that is it, so I try to enable it.

5) Kiva.org lets people decide for themselves how they will work and use the funds, rather than telling them how or what to do, like some "Fair Trade" and other similar top-down organizations.

6) I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I taught English to Japanese college students as well as wrote articles, most frequently about materials design. Occasionally I engage in contractual work, usually proofreading English texts. At present I study engineering, tutor math, and do light automotive repairs.

lenders.name: Marc,Jane, Matt & Claire
lenders.loan_because: We want to help people help themselves, and we want to share our good fortune.

lenders.name: Tom
lenders.loan_because: God has blessed me. I hope to spread this blessing to others and at the same time hope to spread the Good News, that Jesus Christ has died for you, and all you have to do is invite him into your heart.
lenders.occupational_info: I design and create newer and faster computers.

lenders.name: hilaria
lenders.loan_because: for business
lenders.occupational_info: small sari sari / retail store

lenders.name: Shari
lenders.loan_because: I come from a poor family, but with a little help, I made it out ok. I love to travel now and I want to make the world a better place.
lenders.occupational_info: I work at a coffee shop in the city. I'm also a college student. I love it!

lenders.name: Carolinka
lenders.loan_because: I can, at this micro level
lenders.occupational_info: assisting attorney at an NGO represent clients negotiating the byzantine labyrinth of bureaucracy involved in family and refugee/asylee based immigration to the USA.

lenders.name: Anamaria
lenders.loan_because: It's pretty inspiring to see all these entrepreneurs out there in the world who are trying to chase new opportunities and cultivate the ability to choose their own course of development.  Not every individual has a true entrepreneurial spirit---so it's great to be able to contribute and support some special individuals who do.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with mining companies to help them improve their social and environmental performance. (In short, I help them "behave better.") Really though---I work with companies on how to do community engagement and community development in a way that is strategic and makes sense for the business, but also ultimately has true social impact in the host communities where these companies operate.

lenders.name: Blaine
lenders.loan_because: All people deserve to live a happy and healthy life!

lenders.name: Ken
lenders.loan_because: It's the right thing to do.
lenders.occupational_info: I raise corn, soybeans, oats, hay and wheat on a small organic farm.

lenders.name: ann
lenders.loan_because: I'd like to help change the world, one small donation at a time.I'd like to believe  poverty and despair are unacceptable no matter your income, your place of origin, no matter your color and no matter your age.
lenders.occupational_info: I retired from Fed Ex, then opened a small aromatherapy shop,.

lenders.name: Heidrun
lenders.loan_because: I love it to make a difference. The amount of money that I loan buys so much more than in my own country.
lenders.occupational_info: I am developing software for a living. I also write novels, screenplays, and manuals for mental training.

lenders.name: Michael
lenders.loan_because: I believe everyone should.
lenders.occupational_info: I design advertisements for print (mostly for newspapers).

lenders.name: Kevin
lenders.loan_because: I like helping people build sustaining businesses for themselves, because no one likes to be pitied. Teaching people skills and helping to start a new business goes leagues further than handing over a blank check.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm an entrepreneur with an avid interest in web and mobile technologies. I program software, write business documentation, collaborate with talented people, and build useful products for helping people discover the things they'll truly love.

lenders.name: Just Falcons
lenders.loan_because: We're a social justice group in a Catholic High School in the Algonquin Lakeshore Catholic District School Board.  Microcredit is a way to exercise the "preferential option"for helping those who want to help themselves.  Yay!
lenders.occupational_info: Our group organizes events to raise awareness about issues of social injustice in the world in the light of the good news of the gospel.   Our school participates in Habitat for Humanity builds (we went to Harrisburg, Penn. this year) , Earth Day Trash Bash, Microcredit Summit in Halifax 2007, Thinkfast 24 fast to raise funds for Canadian Catholic Organization for Development and Peace, and a Dominican Rep. Exposure Tour every year. We've rasied funds for water purification biofilters for bateys we visit every year in the Dr. We even built our own house in Trenton with Habitat for Humanity.  We also sleep outside in cardboard boxes in the winter to raise funds for Habitat and to try to identify with the Homeless. We participate in Street Retreats in Toronto twice a year to learn about the causes of poverty in Canada.

lenders.name: Patricia and Chuck
lenders.loan_because: We are so fortunate here in the U.S. and take even the smallest things for granted.  I want to share our blessings with others around the world so that they have the chance to be successful at whatever is important to them.

lenders.name: Scarlett
lenders.loan_because:
I want to help individuals who have a dream of making a brighter future for themselves and their families.  I made my first loan when I sold back a textbook and received $50, an unexpected amount.  

I can so easily go about my daily life without thinking about individuals in the developing world who do not always have access to things like education and healthcare that I take for granted.  Loaning is a way for me to feel connected to people who are thriving despite poverty.  

We have a commitment to each other as humans to look out for the well being of others, regardless of any social constructs such as nationality or race.

I believe in Kiva's vision.  I hope to join the Peace Corps with my husband in two years so that I can do more to make this world a better place.  My contribution may be small, but if we all do a little, then a difference can be made.

lenders.name: Solomon Broad
lenders.loan_because:
Please *do not* contact me via Kiva.



The money that I waste on frivolities like a Starbucks coffee or a chocolate bar can make a life-changing difference to these people. It's nothing to me, but it's an awful lot to them.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in a shop, selling building materials. Very humdrum.

lenders.name: Amanda
lenders.loan_because: It's each of our responsibility to make the world a better place.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for our public schools, letting the community know the great things we do to educate children.

lenders.name: Stacy
lenders.loan_because: Everyone deserves a chance to succeed.

lenders.name: Heather
lenders.loan_because: Access to capital is what drives all businesses, and it's great to be able to directly help an individual further their business.

lenders.name: Michael
lenders.loan_because: It can make a difference and feels good
lenders.occupational_info: I find ways of using computers to make my company more efficient

lenders.name: Rosalind
lenders.occupation: Program Manager- Non Profit Childrens Partnership

lenders.name: Elizabeth
lenders.loan_because: My friends and family and I think this is a great way for us to make a huge impact on someone's livlihood.  We like the idea of lending rather than just giving.

lenders.name: yann
lenders.loan_because:
I believe in the principle that if "you teach a man how to fish, he will eat for a lifetime". 
There are tremendously great people out there, let's give them a helping hand to make them achieve their true potential!
lenders.occupational_info: stuck in the business world, I truly believe though that now it is time for a wake up call and positive impact, far from the short-sighted P&L focus!

lenders.name: Edward C
lenders.loan_because: a person to person loan means I can have a sense i know where my money is going and who I am helping.

lenders.name: The Chandler Foundation
lenders.loan_because: "The survival of the world depends upon our sharing what we have and working together.   Fools Crow.     Ceremonial Chief of the Teton Sioux"
lenders.occupational_info: A  Metis Family. Haudenosaune, (Mohawk), Montagnais (First Nation)and French Canadian trying to bring change to our brothers and sisters on the Lakota Sioux Reservation at Pine Ridge, South Dakota (http://nativeprogress.org)and to third world entrepreneur's, via KIVA. We are all remotely related and it's time to even the score among all the peoples of the world! If we do not come together as one, we will surely perish! The small changes that we are able to bring about, will be remembered by generations, of the people we have helped!

lenders.name: Jen
lenders.loan_because: It's cool, and Kiva rocks.
lenders.occupational_info: My employer is an amazing statewide advocacy organization that is working hard to get kids in Washington state the best public education possible.

lenders.name: Robyn
lenders.loan_because: Reaching out and helping is part of why we are here.

lenders.name: Judith
lenders.occupational_info: I work in a large university library in the United States.

lenders.name: Courtland
lenders.loan_because: With the state of the world being what it is, I want to do whatever I can to help improve the lives of those who want to work to build a better life for themselves, their families, and their communities.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a regional manager for a compliance firm.

lenders.name: Rick
lenders.loan_because: I want to make a difference in this world, however small my part may be.
lenders.occupational_info: I work on software. It is sometimes very challenging but rewarding too, and it funds my trips to go diving!  I teach scuba as well to share this awesome world with others.

lenders.name: Patricia
lenders.loan_because: I love the idea of helping someone to help themselves.  If a small loan from me can sustain a family I am getting more than I am giving.
lenders.occupational_info: I build affordable homes for those who need a place to live and have modest resouces.

lenders.name: Phil
lenders.occupational_info: Chips. Computer chips.

lenders.name: Sean
lenders.occupational_info: I help other people manage their money.

lenders.name: Matthew
lenders.occupational_info: I sit in an office and try to look serious.

lenders.name: Justin
lenders.loan_because: This is so much better than blindly donating money.

lenders.name: Sumit
lenders.loan_because: I want to lend a hand in raising the standard of living of others.
lenders.occupational_info: I help companies plan their activities so that they manufacture goods efficiently.

lenders.name: Andy and Serenity
lenders.occupation: Follow Jesus, Love People, Be Simple
lenders.loan_because: We love Jesus, and believe in God's Economy.  The money we have is on loan from Him.  Matthew 25:40.
lenders.occupational_info: We travel the United States and Canada and love people, sharing what we have been given to the poor and marginalized we meet.

lenders.name: Robert
lenders.loan_because: Helping those that wish to help themselves is a priveledge.
lenders.occupational_info: I train competitive boxers and military special forces.

lenders.name: George
lenders.loan_because: If you believe in the capitalist  system, you should practice it.
lenders.occupational_info: Now partially retired, but managed and invested in airline, aviation ground support and publishing companies.

lenders.name: Russ & Elaine
lenders.loan_because: we all need a hand now and again.

lenders.name: toffer
lenders.loan_because: Because I can live without my money longer than most of these people can.

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I research hormone behavior relations in mammals.

lenders.name: Jan
lenders.loan_because: I believe it is hard for women to get business loans and want to give them an equal opportunity - or at least a start.

lenders.name: Mona & Randy Simoneaux
lenders.loan_because: We enjoy it.
lenders.occupational_info: IT Analyst & Administrative Assistant

lenders.name: Anthony Obeyesekere
lenders.loan_because: Changing the world, one step at a time. :)
lenders.occupational_info: I work on economic analysis and forecasting.

lenders.name: Robert
lenders.occupational_info: Ecosystem Restoration

lenders.name: pat
lenders.loan_because: I hope to help others all over the world with their business ventures since I also have a small business too! Peace and best wishes to all!

lenders.name: suki
lenders.loan_because: I want to change the world.

lenders.name: matslats
lenders.loan_because: I believe in human rights, I have spare money, and want to use it better than a commercial bank.
lenders.occupational_info: I make websites for non-profit organisations

lenders.name: Adi S
lenders.loan_because: I just a student on college and work part time on internet cafe
lenders.occupational_info: I'am a operator internet cafe in Jogjakarta - Indonesia.

lenders.name: Dan
lenders.loan_because: As a true Christian, it is imperative to help all people. Christ has blessed my family more than I could ever imagine. Hopefully these loans will bless others.

lenders.name: Kimberly
lenders.loan_because: I can..I would not be were I am, or have what I have, if not for being able to borrow.

lenders.name: Jason
lenders.loan_because: Major social and economic change only happens at the individual - personal level.
lenders.occupational_info: Manage design and fabrication for a sign company.

lenders.name: Wilbur
lenders.loan_because: To help others where possible
lenders.occupational_info: I work on oracle database for a large retailer from Minnesota, USA.

lenders.name: Jerry
lenders.loan_because: Kiva has made it easy to pass forward the gratitude I have, for all that I have been given and at times, have taken for granted.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with communities to realize their visions for the rivers, trails, and open spaces most important to them.   I help them form the partnerships required to effectively conserve, protect & restore the places they value most.

lenders.name: Cassondra
lenders.loan_because: This is such a great opportunity for those of us with limited means, or without huge sums of free cash, to make a real difference in the world. I've always felt a little helpless in the face of some of the world's problems. "What, " I have asked, "Can one person really do?" And suddenly, I've found my answer.
lenders.occupational_info: I love my job because not only do I love books, but because, essentially, I love helping people. I do all sorts of different kinds of helping -- from helping someone find a good book to read, to helping someone find materials to learn English, to helping people find out how to fill out job applications and resumes. I especially love introducing children to the infinite world of books and reading.

lenders.name: Josie
lenders.loan_because: I'm involved with kiva because I can't imagine the impossibilities of  'making it'  without credit institutions.

lenders.name: James
lenders.loan_because: It seems like the right thing to do.

lenders.name: LilithsCircle
lenders.loan_because: We want to engage with the global community by promoting individual businesses which are improving the quality of life for those involved.
lenders.occupational_info: You will find us everywhere doing almost anything that requires creativity, compassion and bravery.

lenders.name: Maria
lenders.loan_because: As the daughter of immigrants, I know the challenges of flourishing financially, and how much a little loan can go a long way.  I don't make much money, however I make enough to get by -  therefore it is my duty to give when I can.  I think everyone just needs a little support sometimes.
lenders.occupational_info: I just graduated from college, my major was acting.  I also write plays and short stories. I recently moved to New York where I waitress/bartend by day and act in plays by night.

lenders.name: Laura
lenders.loan_because: Everyone deserves a chance to better their life, and if I can help, I will.

lenders.name: susan
lenders.loan_because: The difference between me and others is often based on where we were born, not on capabilities.  It seems logical to share and allow others opportunities I came by easily.
lenders.occupational_info: I help companies make sure the work the do can be done without hurting their workers, hurting the environment or making products that could hurt the customers

lenders.name: Ron
lenders.loan_because: I saw Kiva featured on a PBS program and want to help.

lenders.name: Jennifer
lenders.loan_because: Helping others become empowered is a great feeling! We all need a leg up.
lenders.occupational_info: I love to teach in an interactive, creative way. I incorporate music, art  and drama into teaching writing. I also hope to inspire kids to love reading.

lenders.name: The Tais
lenders.loan_because: We all have been blessed with abundance in the States and God calls us to share with those who have less.

lenders.name: Marc
lenders.loan_because: This is a perfect way to directly make a difference to hardworking, smart people who just need a little help.
lenders.occupational_info: I help my clients market their businesses to other businesses who need their products or services.

lenders.name: Alesia
lenders.occupational_info: My husband and I own a small sign business in Dallastown, Pennsylvania.

lenders.name: Raimundo
lenders.loan_because: I believe the only way the world will get better is if each individual does their part in helping others.  I have been blessed and I want to pass these blessings on to others.
lenders.occupational_info: I maintain and repair machining and processing equipment at a production facility.  We machine engine blocks and heads for a large international company.

lenders.name: Brenda
lenders.loan_because: We are all members of the family of man.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach children to read and write.

lenders.name: Jeff and Theresa
lenders.loan_because: we believe in the mandate that to whom much is given, much is required.
lenders.occupational_info: Jeff is a postdoc studying HIV. Theresa edits journals and books and works as a freelance writer.

lenders.name: Andrew
lenders.loan_because: I'm an idealist and a pragmatist. Kiva serves both those interests.

lenders.name: Karl and Janis
lenders.loan_because: We have been given so much and we want to give back - the stories are wonderful - so uplifting

lenders.name: Mike
lenders.loan_because: I am

lenders.name: David Gonzalez
lenders.loan_because:
El pobre carece de muchas cosas, pero el avaro carece de todo.
(Séneca)

lenders.name: Frank
lenders.occupational_info: college professor teaching courses on nuclear issues

lenders.name: scenario
lenders.occupational_info: Living out the purpose I was created for

lenders.name: Grant
lenders.loan_because: Because this is a great idea, it keeps on giving!!!

lenders.name: Claire Elise D.
lenders.loan_because: A woman I do business with had a baby and I thought instead of a gift, lets invest the money in the name of Claire Elise.

lenders.name: Steve
lenders.loan_because: it's the most effective way of getting funds directly to people in need and it's gratifying watching them make the investment grow
lenders.occupational_info: public health researcher

lenders.name: Bill
lenders.loan_because: It's the right thing to do.
lenders.occupational_info: As a park ranger, my job was to protect the park's natural and cultural resources, this includes law enforcement duties, and to educate the public about these resources.

lenders.name: Ivan Barriga
lenders.loan_because: "each of us can work to change a small portion of events, and in the total of all those acts will be written the history of this generation" ~ Robert Kennedy

lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because: It's a great way to see that my donation will have a real affect.
lenders.occupational_info:
Sales and maintenance of industrial supplies.
Expedited delivery of time critical products.

lenders.name: KAREN
lenders.loan_because: I believe everyone deserves a chance!!
lenders.occupational_info: I do a lot of volunteer work through an NGO and I take part in internationall youth seminars. That's untill I go for a Masters program in Criminology :D

lenders.name: Peter
lenders.loan_because: My good friend Jen has taught me to look beyond the area that I live in and open my eyes to the needs of people around the world.  I lead a good life, and I want to share that with people who just need a helping hand.  What Jen has told me and made me aware of has made me realize that even doing something little can make a big difference.  She will change the world one of these days, and I hope that little things like this will help her in her future endevours of making the world a better place.

lenders.name: Lucious
lenders.loan_because:
l want to start a transport business. it's capital cost is $12,000.00.
l'll repay the loan in 3yrs time. $720 monthly.
lenders.occupational_info: business is the way of life in most third world countries

lenders.name: Molly
lenders.loan_because: I consider myself so fortunate, I'd like to help someone else, even a little bit, as others have helped me.

lenders.name: Ian
lenders.occupation: Grad Student/ Citizen of the World

lenders.name: Ray
lenders.loan_because: Poverty alleviation is one of the most pressing issues facing our global society in the 21st century.  Micro-finance presents an innovative solution that empowers low income entrepreneurs throughout the developing world to improve their lives through self-sufficiency.

lenders.name: Doug
lenders.loan_because: I care. I can. I want to help.
lenders.occupational_info: I help enable analysis of information to make better business decisions.

lenders.name: de la Chevrotiere family
lenders.loan_because: I know it's difficult to survive in this world and with a little love and more spontaneous acts of kindness, we can change the world one person at a time.  God bless KIVA

lenders.name: Guillaume
lenders.loan_because: I hope my little contribution will help people set up their business and have a better life
